means: 基本原理( rudiment的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: She learned the rudiments of brick-laying, wiring and plumbing.
sentence.Network_cn: 她学习了砌砖、布线和管道工程的基本知识。

sentence.Network_en: He has just learned the rudiments of Chinese.
She helped to build a house, learning the rudiments of brick-laying as she went along.
sentence.Network_cn: 她参与了盖房子，并在施工过程中学习了砌砖的基本技巧。

entry.tran: 基础知识;入门知识;基本原理
entry.def: When you learn the rudiments of something, you learn the simplest or most essential things about it.

example.ex: She helped to build a house, learning the rudiments of brick-laying as she went along.
example.tran: 她参与了盖房子，并在施工过程中学习了砌砖的基本技巧。

means.word_mean: 1. a statement of fundamental facts or principles

auth_sentence.content: There were barely the rudiments of realism.
auth_sentence.res_content: There were barely the rudiments of realism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There were barely the rudiments of realism.

auth_sentence.content: Lessons in the rudiments of theology.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lessons in the rudiments of theology.

auth_sentence.content: Victor learned some of the rudiments of speech, but he never progressed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Victor learned some of the rudiments of speech, but he never progressed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Victor learned some of the rudiments of speech, but he never progressed.
